sen.j: 持明院統（じみょういんとう）とは、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代にかけて皇位に即いた日本の皇室の系統で、第88代後嵯峨天皇の子である第89代後深草天皇の子孫である。
sen.e: Jimyoin-to is Japanese royal family ancestry between Kamakura period and Nambokucho Period/the Southern and Northern Court Period and is an ancestor of the 89th Emperor FUKAKUSA whose father is the 88th Emperor GO-SAGA.
sen.cmt: 南北朝時代 http://www.jssus.org/nkp/koto.html、http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/n/nanbokuchoujidai.htm 後嵯峨天皇 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)
sen.e: Jimyoin-to was Japanese Royal Family ancestry between the Kamakura period and the Nambokucho period (the Southern and Northern Court period) and is an ancestor of the 89th Emperor Fukakusa, whose father was the 88th Emperor Go-saga.

Jimyoin-to was Japanese Imperial Family ancestry between the late Kamakura period and the Southern and Northern Courts period and is a descendant of the eighty-ninth Emperor Go-Fukakusa, whose father was the eighty-eighth Emperor Go-saga.
sen.cmt: 「祖先と子孫混同」を訳しなおしました。名前の間違えを訂正しました。南北朝時代の訳を修正

sen.j: 持明院統という名称は、鎮守府将軍藤原基頼が邸内に持仏堂を創設し、これを持明院と名づけ、その一家を持明院家と称したことに端を発する。
sen.e: The name Jimyoin-to came from the Buddhist temple built in his palace, by FUJIWARA no Mototyori, general of Chinjufu, it was called Jimyoin-to and whole family was called Jimyoin-to family.

The name Jimyoin-to came from the Buddhist temple built in his palace, by Fujiwara no Mototyori, a general of Chinjufu; it was called Jimyoin-to, and the entire family was called the Jimyoin-to Family.
The name Jimyoin-to came from the Buddhist temple built in his palace by FUJIWARA no Motoyori, a general of Chinjufu; it was called Jimyoin, and the entire family was called the Jimyoin-to Family.
sen.cmt: 名字大文字名称の間違えを訂正しました。スペルミス

sen.j: 基頼の孫持明院基家の娘陳子（のぶこ）は守貞親王の妃になり、承久の乱で三上皇が配流になった為、幕府の沙汰によって、守貞親王の子茂仁親王（後堀河天皇）が天皇となった（守貞親王には太上天皇の尊号がおくられ、後高倉院と称した）。
sen.e: The daughter of Motoie JIMYOIN, Nobuko, Motoyori's grandchild, became an Empress of Imperial Prince Morisada, due to the officials of the shogunate's decision his son Imperial Prince Yutahito (Emperor GO-HORIKAWA) became an Emperor. (Imperial Prince Morisada received a respected name of Dajo Tenno and later called Go-Takakurain.
sen.cmt: 守貞親王 英辞郎 on the WEB (-親王)
sen.e: Nobuko, the daughter of Motoie Jimyoin and the grandchild of Motoyori, became the Empress of Imperial Prince Morisada, due to the officials of the shogunate's decision that his son, Imperial Prince Yutahito (Emperor Go-Horikawa) would become an Emperor (Imperial Prince Morisada received a respected name of Dajo Tenno and was later called Go-Takakurain).

Nobuko, the daughter of Motoie JIMYOIN and the grandchild of Motoyori, became the wife of Crown Prince Morisada and, because three retired emperors were sentenced to exile after the Jokyu disturbance, Crown Prince Morisada's son Imperial Prince Yutahito was enthroned as emperor (taking the name Go-Horikawa) in accordance with the instructions of the bakufu (Imperial Prince Morisada received the respected name of Dajo Tenno and was later called Go-Takakurain).
sen.cmt: I can't imagine what the translator was thinking when he/she translated "妃" as "Empress". I'm not sure I follow the logic of the Japanese so please check if I have understood this correctly.

sen.j: そして、後堀河天皇は譲位後、持明院邸内を仙洞御所として居住したが、その後、後嵯峨、後深草両上皇もこれに倣って持明院邸内に住んだ。
sen.e: Emperor Go-HORIKAWA named and lived in the Jimyo-in palace as Sento Imperial Palace, the retired GO-SAGA and GO-FUKAKUSA Emperor lived in the same palace.
Emperor Go-Horikawa named and lived in the Jimyo-in palace as Sento Imperial Palace; and the retired Emperors Go-saga and Go-Fukakusa lived in the same palace.
Emperor Go-Horikawa named and lived in the Jimyo-in palace as Sento Imperial Palace; and the retired Emperors Go-Saga and Go-Fukakusa lived in the same palace.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を修正しました。

sen.j: これらにより、後深草天皇から後小松天皇に至る系統のことを持明院統と称された。
sen.e: Due to this situation the inherit from Emperor GO-FUKAKUSA to Emperor GO-KOMATSU is called Jimyoin-to.
The situation inherited from Emperor Go-Fukakusa by Emperor Go-Komatsu is called Jimyoin-to.
Accordingly, the line from Emperor Go-Fukakusa to Emperor Go-Komatsu is called Jimyoin-to.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 院政を敷いた後嵯峨上皇が、後深草上皇の弟亀山天皇の子孫（大覚寺統）が皇位を継承するよう遺言して崩御したために、後深草と亀山の間で対立が起こり、鎌倉幕府により、両者の子孫の間でほぼ十年をめどに交互に皇位を継承（両統迭立）し、院政を行うよう裁定された。
sen.e: The retired Emperor GO-SAGA, who started cloister government, left a will for retired Emperor GO-FUKAKUSA's brother, Emperor KAMEYAMA's descendant (Daikakuji-to) to succeed imperial throne, this caused the conflict with each others, it was decided by the Kamakura Shougunate to share the imperial throne between ancestors from both sides for every ten years rotation (Ryoto Teiritsu) and continue to run the cloister government.
sen.cmt: 鎌倉幕府 英辞郎 on the WEB 院政 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The retired Emperor Go-Saga, who started a cloister government, left a will for the brother of the retired Emperor Go-Fukakusa, Emperor Kameyama's descendant (Daikakuji-to), to succeed to the Imperial Throne, and this caused the mutual conflict; therefore, it was decided by the Kamakura shogunate to share the Imperial Throne between ancestors from both sides on the basis of a rotation every 10 years (Ryoto Teiritsu) and to continue running the cloister government.

The retired Emperor Go-Saga, who started a cloister government, left a will for the brother of the retired Emperor Go-Fukakusa, Emperor Kameyama's descendant (Daikakuji-to), to succeed to the Imperial Throne, and this caused the mutual conflict; therefore, it was decided by the Kamakura shogunate to share the Imperial Throne between ancestors from both sides on the basis of a rotation every 10 years (Ryoto Teiritsu) and to continue running the cloister government.

sen.j: 大覚寺統の傍流から出た後醍醐天皇による建武の新政により、一時は皇統が大覚寺統に統一されたかに見えたが、新政は2年半にして崩壊する。
sen.e: It seemed the royal heritage was unified by Daikakuji-to after the start of Kemmu Restoration by Emperor GO-DAIGO who was from minor member of Daikaku-ji, however the new government collapsed in two and a half years.

Apparently, the royal heritage was unified by Daikakuji-to after the start of the Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Go-Daigo, who was from a minor member of Daikaku-ji; however, the new government collapsed after two-and-a-half years.

Apparently, the royal heritage was unified by Daikakuji-to after the start of the Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Go-Daigo, who was from a minor member of Daikakuji-to; however, the new government collapsed after two-and-a-half years.
sen.cmt: 名称の間違えを訂正しました。

sen.j: 吉野に逃れた後醍醐天皇に代えて、足利尊氏は持明院統（北朝）の光明天皇を擁立する。
sen.e: After Emperor GO-DAIGO escaped to Yoshino, Takauji ASHIKAGA backed up Emperor KOMYO from Jimyoin-to. (the Northern court)
After Emperor Go-Daigo escaped to Yoshino, Takauji Ashikaga backed up Emperor Komyo from Jimyoin-to (the Northern court).
After Emperor Go-Daigo escaped to Yoshino, Takauji ASHIKAGA backed up Emperor Komyo from Jimyoin-to (the Northern court).

sen.j: 後醍醐は自己の正統性を主張し（南朝）、南北朝時代となる。
sen.e: As the Emperor GO-DAIGO insisted to stay in power in his side (the Southern Court), this was the beginning of Nambokucho Period/the Southern and Northern Court Period.
As the Emperor Go-Daigo insisted that power remain on his side (the Southern Court), this was the beginning of the Nambokucho period (the Southern and Northern Court period).
As the Go-Daigo insisted that power remain on his side (the Southern Court), this was the beginning of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: Emperor削除南北朝時代の訳を修正

sen.j: 一般的に現在の日本の皇室は、この持明院統の子孫と言われているが、持明院統嫡流とされている後光厳院流は後小松天皇の子である称光天皇の代で断絶しており、厳密に言えば持明院統の分家（崇光天皇の子孫、崇光院流）と位置付けられてきた伏見宮家が現在の皇室の直接の祖先にあたる。
sen.e: Generally speaking it is said that Jimyoin-to's ancestors are current royal family, the legitimate highbred of Jimyoin-to, Go-Kogon'in-ryu was extinguished after the generation of Emperor SHOKO, son of Emperor GO-KOMATSU, strictly speaking the direct ancestors of royal family is Fushimi-no-Miya family, who was in the position of cadet family (the descendant Emperor SUKO, Suko'in-ryu) of Jimyoin-to.
sen.cmt: 後光厳院流 定訳不明, 伏見宮家 http://nipponkichi.jp/article_list.do;jsessionid=31B8553CCAA7101576AFA93D355F6741?kwd=156&ml_lang=en, 崇光院流 定訳不明
sen.e: Generally, it is said that Jimyoin-to's ancestors are the current Royal Family; but the legitimate highbred of Jimyoin-to, Go-Kogon'in-ryu was extinguished after the generation of Emperor Shoko, son of Emperor Go-komatsu. Strictly speaking, the direct ancestor of the Royal Family is the Fushimi-no-Miya Family, which was in the position of a cadet family (the descendant Emperor Suko, Suko'in-ryu) of Jimyoin-to.

Generally, it is said that Jimyoin-to's ancestors are the current Imperial Family; but the legitimate highbred of Jimyoin-to, Go-Kogon'in-ryu was extinguished after the generation of Emperor Shoko, son of Emperor Go-Komatsu, and strictly speaking the direct ancestor of the Imperial Family is the Fushimi-no-Miya Family, which was in the position of a cadet family (the descendant of Emperor Suko, Suko'in-ryu) of Jimyoin-to.
